posts._title: Duygu Sagiroglu – Bitmeyen Yol AKA The Never Ending Road (1965)
posts.title: Bitmeyen Yol
posts.excerpt: Quote:In Turkey in the 1960s, six unemployed friends struggle in life, some even driven to crime… Bitmeyen Yol which is sometimes natural and sometimes lyrical, made in 1965 is Sagiroglu’s first and most successful directing experience also reflecting the highest stage of Turkish social realist movement. posts._title: Santiago Álvarez – Hasta la victoria siempre (1967)
posts.title: Hasta la victoria siempre
posts.excerpt: Cuban agit-prop filmmaker Santiago Alvarez produced this radical newsreel within forty-eight hours of Che Guevara’s death by special request of Fidel Castro himself. Fellow filmmaker and Alvarez admirer Travis Wilkerson accordingly calls it “a pure distillation of the highly unusual conditions of production” that spurred Alvarez’s “urgent cinema.” Incorporating Guevara’s own speeches and documentary scraps …

posts._title: Santiago Álvarez – De América soy hijo… y a ella me debo AKA I Am A Son Of America… And I Am Indebted To It (1975)
posts.title: De América soy hijo… y a ella me debo
posts.excerpt: Santiago Alvarez’ account of the trip by Fidel Castro to Chile in November 1971, expanded into an historical view of imperialist exploitation across Latin America.
posts.titleEnglish: I Am A Son Of America… And I Am Indebted To It

posts.title: Navajazo (2014)
posts.excerpt: The imagined apocalypse presented to us through portraits of characters struggling to survive in a hostile environment, where all they have is each other, and the only thing they posses in common is the will to keep on living, no matter the cost. (IMDB)

posts.title: The Frontier Experience
posts.excerpt: The Westward movement — and a woman’s perspective of that movement — emerges in the dramatic story of Delilah Fowler’s first year on the Kansas frontier in 1869. Based on diaries of the period, the program reveals the cruel violence, and even crueler loneliness, which early settlers encountered — but above all, it shows the …

posts.title: Schellebelle 1919
posts.excerpt: Schellebelle 1919 tells the story of the Van De Veldes. The eldest daughter Coralie – only 16 years old herself – took as many as 25 war orphans into her home during the First World War. Yet the family is threatened from different sides. posts._title: Paulo Rocha – Os Verdes Anos AKA The Green Years (1963)
posts.title: Os Verdes Anos
posts.excerpt: Julio, aged nineteen, has just left the provinces to settle down in the outskirts of Lisbon. He lives there in a poor area with his uncle Raul and starts working as an apprentice shoemaker. At the shop, he gets to know Ilda, a young housemaid and regular customer. posts._title: Peter Chan – Tau ming chong aka The Warlords (2007)
posts.title: Tau ming chong
posts.excerpt: The film is set in the 1860s, during the Taiping Rebellion in the late Qing Dynasty in China.
